analysis.Summary: This file defines and exports a Vue Router route configuration object for the backoffice "Pages" section. It sets up the base path, metadata (including titles and sidebar components), and three child routes for listing pages, adding a new page, and editing an existing page.
analysis.Purpose: Serve as a router module in the martyrs backoffice, registering all URL patterns, metadata and component loaders for the "Pages" area of the application.

Components.name: Sidebar
responsibilities: Main sidebar layout for the backoffice pages section
Injected via route meta to render navigation

Components.name: SidebarPages
responsibilities: Sidebar layout used specifically on add/edit page routes
Injected via route meta for contextual navigation

Functions.name: component resolver
Functions.description: Dynamically imports the specified Vue component to enable code-splitting. All child routes use this pattern with webpackChunkName 'Pages'.

analysis.Usage: Imported into the main backoffice router index (e.g. router/index.js) and spread into the routes array to activate '/pages', '/pages/add', and '/pages/:url+' routes.
Notes: Uses Vue Router's dynamic import syntax for lazy loading and webpack chunk naming.
Child route ':url+' uses a custom regex '+' to match one or more segments, enabling nested page URLs.
Meta fields include i18n-ready title objects and sidebar component references for dynamic layout.
